intro: Basselinia deplanchei, commonly known as the Tasmanian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, fiery red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces woody pods that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and public spaces across Australia.
